qas.question: Who wrote an opera in Sanskrit?
On what was the Philip Glass opera based?
Which well known performer has used Sanskrit chants in her music?
Which composer featured Sanskrit music in his movies?
What is the source of the theme song of Battlestar Galactica?
What is the opera created by Steven Glass that uses Sanskrit?
What modern singer sang chants from Satyagraha?
Where did the Gayatri Mantra taken from Rigveda come from?
What song sung by Enigma is a vinyasa yoga chant?

context: <b5_0>Satyagraha<b5_0/>, an opera by <a0_0><b6_0>Philip Glass<b6_0/><a0_0/>, uses texts from the <a1_0>Bhagavad Gita<a1_0/>, sung in Sanskrit. The closing credits of The Matrix Revolutions has a prayer from the Brihadaranyaka Upanishad. The song "Cyber-raga" from <a2_0><b7_0>Madonna<b7_0/><a2_0/>'s album Music includes Sanskrit chants, and Shanti/Ashtangi from her 1998 album Ray of Light, which won a Grammy, is the ashtanga vinyasa yoga chant. The lyrics include the mantra Om shanti. Composer <a3_0>John Williams<a3_0/> featured choirs singing in Sanskrit for Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom and in Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace. The theme song of <b8_0>Battlestar Galactica 2004<b8_0/> is the Gayatri Mantra, taken from the <a4_0>Rigveda<a4_0/>. The lyrics of "<b9_0>The Child In Us<b9_0/>" by Enigma also contains Sanskrit verses.[better source needed].
